reportSummary.summary: The Bell Creek-West Prong Muddy Creek Watershed Implementation Plan aims to reduce nutrient and sediment loading to meet water quality standards and improve aquatic life support in the Bell Creek and West Prong Muddy Creek watersheds in Tippah County, Mississippi. The plan covers a three-year project period from 2011 to 2014, detailing BMP installations, education and outreach efforts, a monitoring strategy, and stakeholder involvement to address biological impairments identified through TMDLs.
reportSummary.watershedName: Bell Creek-West Prong Muddy Creek Watershed
reportSummary.planTitle: Bell Creek-West Prong Muddy Creek Watershed Implementation Plan
organizations: Mississippi Soil and Water Conservation Commission
Tippah County Soil and Water Conservation District

goals.description: Reduce nutrient and sediment loading to achieve water quality standards for Low DO/Organic enrichment, nutrient narrative standards, and Fish and Wildlife Support designated use.
goals.sourceExcerpt: Reduce nutrient and sediment loading, achieve standards for Low DO/Organic enrichment and narrative standards for nutrient loading, and Fish and Wildlife Support designated use

bmps.name: Streambank and Shoreline Protection
bmps.description: Installation of streambank and shoreline protection structures to reduce sediment input.

bmps.name: Grade Stabilization Structures
bmps.description: Construct grade stabilization structures to control erosion and sedimentation.

bmps.name: Pasture and Hay Land Planting
bmps.description: Planting pasture and hay lands to reduce sediment and nutrient loading.
bmps.sourceExcerpt: Pasture and Hay Land Planting 100 acres $200/ac $20,000

bmps.name: Water and Sediment Control Basins
bmps.description: Construct basins to control water flow and reduce sediment transport.
bmps.sourceExcerpt: Water and Sediment Control Basin 4 structures $10,000/ ea $40,000

bmps.name: Nutrient Management
bmps.description: Practice nutrient management on agricultural lands to reduce nutrient runoff.

bmps.name: Tank/Trough
bmps.description: Install watering tanks and troughs for livestock to reduce stream access.

bmps.name: Diversions
bmps.description: Install diversions to redirect runoff and reduce sediment loads.

bmps.name: Heavy Use Area Protection
bmps.description: Protect heavy use areas to reduce soil erosion and compaction.

bmps.name: Fencing
bmps.description: Install fencing to control livestock access and reduce nutrient and sediment input to streams.

bmps.name: Critical Area Planting
bmps.description: Plant critical areas to reduce erosion and improve water quality.

implementation.description: Assist NRCS, USGS, Tippah County SWCD, and MDEQ in forming Watershed Implementation Team (WIT).
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Assist NRCS, USGS, and Tippah County SWCD, with assistance from MDEQ, in the development of a Watershed Implementation Team (WIT).

implementation.description: Develop Watershed Implementation Plan consistent with guidance and WIT input.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Develop a Watershed Implementation Plan (WIP) consistent with MDEQ guidance and assistance from the WIT.

implementation.description: Assist in development and implementation of watershed monitoring plan.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Assist in the development and implementation of a watershed monitoring plan for the project.

implementation.description: Conduct landowner meetings, obtain commitments, and develop conservation plans.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Conduct a landowner meeting to inform potential participants about the project...Develop plans for BMPs...Assist landowners in installation of appropriate BMPs.

implementation.description: Establish demonstration farms and hold informational field days/tours.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Establish at least two demonstration farms...Provide at least two informational field days/tours.

implementation.description: Erect signage identifying BMP locations and distribute educational materials.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Erect no fewer than 20 project roadside signs where water quality practices are installed...Develop and distribute fact sheets.

implementation.description: Monitor pollutant load reductions through water quality monitoring and photo documentation.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Post BMP monitoring...Photo documentation...Collect GPS coordinates and data on all BMPs installed.

implementation.description: Submit bi-annual and final reports to MDEQ documenting project progress and outcomes.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Submit bi-annual reports...Make final report to MDEQ.

monitoring.parameter: Biological Impairment due to Nutrients and Low Dissolved Oxygen
monitoring.method: Water sampling and monitoring plan developed and implemented by USGS, MDEQ, and partners
monitoring.frequency: Pre- and post-BMP monitoring over project period

thresholds.description: Daily average not less than 5.0 mg/L with instantaneous minimum not less than 4.0 mg/L
Waters shall be free from pollutants that create harmful conditions per narrative standards (no numeric criteria)
Geometric means and maximums per season as per 2002 Water Quality Standards

monitoring.sourceExcerpt: Water samples will be taken and analyzed for organic enrichment/low dissolved oxygen and nutrient content. After BMPs are installed, additional samples will be taken and analyzed to determine load reduction.

outreach.description: Install signs at BMP sites to identify installed practices to landowners and public.
outreach.schedule: As BMPs are completed through project period
outreach.sourceExcerpt: Signs identifying the BMPs that have been installed will be erected throughout the watershed upon permission of landowners.

outreach.description: Conduct meetings and field days to inform landowners and public about BMP implementation and benefits.
outreach.indicator: Attendance counts and new participants installing BMPs
outreach.sourceExcerpt: There will be a landowner meeting held to inform landowners...at least two field days to highlight the BMPs.

outreach.description: Develop and distribute 1,000 fact sheets about the project and BMP results.
outreach.sourceExcerpt: A fact sheet will be developed at the end of the project...1,000 fact sheets will be designed and distributed.

outreach.description: Present Watershed Harmony Puppet Show to promote water quality awareness.
outreach.sourceExcerpt: Watershed Harmony will be presented before August 2014.

outreach.description: Set up booth at Tippah County Fair with project materials and activities for children and adults.
outreach.sourceExcerpt: A booth will be set up at the fair...Coloring books and crayons will be given to children on family night.

outreach.description: Design and mail flyers to watershed homes informing homeowners about water quality protection.
outreach.sourceExcerpt: A flyer will be designed and mailed out to the homes in the Bell/Muddy watershed.

outreach.description: Make presentations to civic organizations about water quality and nonpoint source pollution.
outreach.sourceExcerpt: Presentations relating to water quality will be made to civic organizations.

outreach.description: Run radio ads to inform about water quality and nonpoint source pollution.
outreach.indicator: Number of ads run and produced
outreach.sourceExcerpt: Radio advertisements will be run on the local radio station.

outreach.description: Conduct Adopt-A-Stream workshops to promote watershed stewardship and monitoring.
outreach.schedule: At least one event before September 2014
outreach.sourceExcerpt: At least one event will take place before September 30, 2014.

geographicAreas.sourceExcerpt: The Muddy Creek Watershed is approximately 63,682 acres...Hydrologic Unit Code (HUC) code for the watershed is 08010207.

geographicAreas.watershedName: Bell Creek-West Prong Muddy Creek Subwatershed
geographicAreas.sourceExcerpt: The targeted area of this watershed is the Bell Creek-West Prong Muddy Creek Subwatershed...19,277 acres located within the watershed boundaries.

contacts.organization: Mississippi Soil and Water Conservation Commission

contacts.name: Tippah County Soil and Water Conservation District
contacts.organization: Tippah County Soil and Water Conservation District
